com.idibon.api.util

Class Memoize<Type>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idibon.api.util.Memoize<Type>

  • public class Memoize<Type>
extends Object
    Memoize can be used to perform memoization of arbitrary types, as long as the type implements hashCode consistently with equals. This can be used to ensure that any two equal instances of a particular object will always refer to the same instance. Instances are cached in memory until evicted by the garbage collector. Every method in this class is thread-safe.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> Memoize<T> cacheReferences(Class<T> type)
      Creates a memoizer that caches memoized objects as long as memory is available.
      static <T> Memoize<T> liveReferences(Class<T> type)
      Creates a memoizer that only memoizes objects as long as a reference to the object is reachable (accessible from any scope in the program).
      Type memoize(Type instance)
      Memoizes the provided object instance.
      Type remove(Type instance)
      Removes an existing reference from the pool.

        Memoizes the provided object instance.
